boardgame.name: Original Deutschland Rallye
boardgame.description:
The players chose one of the ten routes and mark the 25 listed cities with green pawns (markers). Each player has to get five cars from start to finish. Movement is determined by a die. The players roll for each car already on the route.

Points are awarded for collecting the green markers (1 point) and opponent cars (5 points) by landing on the same town. Cars in big cities (100.000 residents or more) are only set back a number of cities according to the last roll.

If a green marker is collected, it is replaced by a red one. Red markers have to be collected too, but are counting -5 points. Each car reaching the destination counts 10 points.

The game ends when all remaining cars have arrived at the destination. The player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Clarifications and Modifications for "What Price Glory!"
boardgame.description:
User summary:

This document presents page-by-page commentary and corrections for the base rules.

boardgame.name: Sorcery
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Sorcery is an art that has combined multiple practices for evil means and ends. In the beginning, sorcery was sparse, and only used by a few separate users who combined arcane arts such as magic, demonology, alchemy, witchcraft, etc. A few were successful and passed the knowledge.

User summary:

Presents an alternate concept and method for spell-casting.

boardgame.name: COVID Survivor
boardgame.description:
A deadly virus is seeping throughout the entire globe and is about to infect YOU! How will you protect yourself? Will you play your cards right? The coronavirus is highly contagious and your only chance of survival is how you play the game!

Will you handle social distancing activities seriously? Have you stocked up on toilet paper and hand sanitizer? Are you wearing PPE? Let's hope so because your COVID survival can go from minor to fatal in just a few plays!

On their turn, each player rolls a die to see if they become infected or their health worsens. Then, play action cards to mitigate the chances of infection, or increase other players' chances of infection. Use PPE cards to protect yourself, and collect sets of Social Distancing cards to take special actions. If you reach the bottom of the track, you have died. The last player left alive wins.

boardgame.name: Astro Wars
boardgame.description:
Exciting battles in space!

Explore asteroids and planets to recover resources, move across the hyperspace, and fight your enemies across the galaxy.

You roll the die to see how many squares you can move your spaceship or space cruiser, then if you are at close range you can fire your laser, and if you are at long range you can launch your thermonuclear missiles.
The battle computer will decide the combat results. Red - target destroyed, yellow target damaged, green no damage.

You will need oxygen (to travel in hyperspace and to repair damage), titanium (to repair damage), energy for your lasers and missiles... so you have to visit planets and asteroids to gather resources.

You can also travel in hyperspace... but you risk arriving on a supernova or a meteor field, so be careful.

boardgame.name: The Cloud Dungeon 2: Sunken Dungeon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A creative game night of coloring, cut-and-paste, and choose-your-own-adventure decisions.

1-6 players color and construct their characters, buying and attaching armor and weapons, and making their own, utterly unique creation. Your party is 'borrowing' a submarine and setting out for the Sunken Dungeon: a defunct, dangerous place full of sea creatures, monsters, and green olives. You're hoping there's treasure in there, someplace.

Through the process, you'll be engaging in hand-to-claw combat with crabs, electrifying whales, and working together to pilot your submarine in intense submarine battles.

Along the way, you'll be making choose-your-own adventure style decisions as a team, with huge (and ridiculous) consequences. You'll lose your leg, have starfish plastered all over you, and tangle with a Very Cheerful Squid who wants to kill you.

It's creative, ridiculous fun for any player who is creative, loves coloring, or wants to have a fun coloring adventure with their friends, family, or game group.

boardgame.name: Cluedo: Charleroi 1666
boardgame.description:
The classic detective game! With a historical twist.
1666, the fortress of Charleroi in Belgium.
The king Charles II is murdered, but who did it ?


Une intrigue, six suspects, six armes et neuf lieux historiques…
Bienvenue dans le plus célèbre des jeux de déduction personnalisé à l’occasion des 350 ans de la plus grande métropole wallonne.

Charleroi, septembre 1666. La vie du jeune roi Charles II
est menacée… Il se murmure que l’héritier de Philippe IV
trouverait la mort de la main de l’une des personnes
de son entourage direct ou indirect.

Au départ de cette fiction, le jeu nous plonge dans le « Charleroy » du XVIIème siècle pour nous suggérer des situations rythmées par des conquêtes, la soif du pouvoir et de l’argent.
Les enquêteurs ont établi une liste de 6 suspects potentiels, de 6 armes du crime et de 9 lieux où se projette cette conspiration.
Parcourez l’ancienne forteresse à la recherche d’indices, posez les bonnes questions au bon moment et retournez toutes les cartes.
Serez-vous le premier à trouver la clé du mystère ?
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Cluedo / Clue (Parker Brothers, et al)

boardgame.name: Maze Knights
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Maze Knights is set on Wreckworld, a shattered, overgrown planet strewn with the wrecks of vessels from innumerable civilizations and planes of reality.

The City of Mazegate is the party's home base, a thriving metropolis of wreck survivors shielded from danger by scavenged magical artifacts.

All magic on Wreckworld is powered by mana, a mineral found in monsters, magical artifacts called relics, and underground veins.

The PCs are adventurers with their own mana-powered airship, scavenging in the ruins for mana and useful artifacts.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Charleroi
boardgame.description:
The classic Monopoly with a Charleroi (Belgium) twist.

In addition to green houses and red hotels, you can buy wine cellars, stolen cars workshops, or even brothels.
The Monopoly of Charleroi has... four jails !
When you pass GO you receive the usual €200, plus €200 in bribe.

boardgame.name: Sun Dogs
boardgame.description:
Sun Dogs is about exploring our inner solar system, altering your body, and embracing death.

In a future where humanity alters itself without a second thought, you must do the same. Skim along the Sun's corona, float in the Venusian clouds, travel the Martian plains. When your body dies, your mind will be given a new one, and you will keep going.

Featuring an expansive world of unique science fiction, spread across planets, moons, and space stations. Dynamic text reacts to your character and your actions, and a full modding system allows you to rewrite the entire game.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Agent Hugo: Lemoon Twist
boardgame.description:
The evil Dr. Hypno has embarked on a dastardly plot to take over the world. He has built a hypno-satellite, which he plans to launch into space from his secret island fortress, guarded by his hyper-mad-hypnotised minions. Once again Agent HUGO returns as the ever-resourceful secret agent in a battle against time to stop this mad scientist.

Enjoy hours of fun as Agent HUGO in an exciting adventure with his top secret team ready to help him through his most daring mission to date. Will he manage to find the secret hiding place of Dr. Hypno and stop his vicious plan before it is too late? Good luck Agent HUGO ... this time you'll need it.

boardgame.name: Lycee Overture
boardgame.description:
The new version of old Japanese collectible card game Lycee. The publisher changed to Movic.
Characters in this game are from animes, galgames and mobile games(such as FGO).
The object of the game is to get one's opponent's sixty card deck down to zero, which is mostly done by attacking with character cards.

boardgame.name: Monster Bounty Hunters
boardgame.description:
Monster Bounty Hunters is a quick-fire card game for 1-8 players with plenty of different gameplay options for players of all levels and abilities.

Professor Hawkesbury has genetically engineered the scariest monsters in the world for a brand new exhibition in his Monster Park, but a freak storm caused a power outage meaning they all escaped and are now on the loose.

The Professor has asked you to assemble a special team of Bounty Hunters to round them all up.

For every monster you capture there's a reward on offer, but if the monsters escape into the world for good you’ll have to pay a fine for your failure.

Let's get hunting...

boardgame.name: Aftermath: Feldherr Insert
boardgame.description:
How mankind disappeared? Nobody knows for sure. But honestly, there are more important issues for our heroic rodents. To ensure the survival of their colony, for example. And the basic requirement for that: to defy all dangers even in a fateful world.

With this Feldherr foam set you make at least the immediate world safer for Meziah, Grumple, Ringr and Whisper and at the same time you bring order into the post-apocalyptic chaos.


The set fits exactly into the original "Aftermath" board game box by Plaid Hat Games.
Provides safe space for all 23 figures and all accessories of the core game. All cards also fit with sleeves.
Includes plastic card holder for storing the small playing cards.
The 7 deck boxes are located next to the top foam insert. The Adventure Book, the Downtown Travel Map, the Campaign Dashboard, and the Sideboard are placed on top.
The lid of the board game box protrudes approx. 4-5 cm.


The set includes:

1 foam tray for miniatures (ELMEWT060BO)
1 foam tray for accessories (AWMEPR035BO)
1 card holder made of plastic
2 foam toppers


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mini Rogue: Cloth Bag
boardgame.description:
A 9cm x 12cm (3.5" x 4.7") black cloth bag with golden markings.

Store your dice, tokens, meeples and cubes in it, or hold the Original Mini Rouge 9-card microgame.

boardgame.name: Mini Rogue: Extra Dice
boardgame.description: 1 extra set of 6 dice & cloth bag. This was a Kickstarter add-on for the 2020 campaign.

boardgame.name: Tribunal 1920
boardgame.description:
New York 1920, Play as a lawyer and try to win 3 trial hearings !
In this bluff game, you will have to place your pawns in court thanks to the cards you have in hand.
If a player places 3 pawns in a row on a grid, he wins the audience and approaches victory.

Will you be a good lawyer ?

boardgame.name: Undaunted: Reinforcements
Неустрашимые: подкрепление
boardgame.description:
In North Africa, the Long Range Desert Group is a thorn in the sides of the Italian forces, disrupting vital lines of communication and striking at strategic targets ranging far and wide. In Normandy, U.S. forces brace against German counterattack, determined to maintain their foothold in the region. The fighting is intense, and the outcome hangs on a knife's edge. With everything at stake, you desperately need reinforcements!

Undaunted: Reinforcements is a modular expansion that introduces a range of new rules, scenarios, and units. Unleash the might of the German and American tanks and see how your new squad options fare against them in Undaunted: Normandy, or make use of mines, assault aircraft, and other new units as you attempt to outfox your opponent in Undaunted: North Africa. Whether you have one Undaunted game or the other, with Reinforcements you can play for the first time in a four-player mode, or test your mettle in a solo mode by Dávid Turczi and David Digby.

Requires a copy of Undaunted: Normandy or Undaunted: North Africa to play.

boardgame.name: Pugs in Mugs
boardgame.description:
Pugs in Mugs is a family-friendly game about collecting pugs, for 2 - 5 players, ages 6 and up.

Collect a host of adorable pooches, snatch your favourites from opponents, steal Mugs in acts of utter thievery or demand the cards you need to be victorious!

Did we say this was family friendly..?

In Pugs in Mugs, players randomly draw pugs of five different colour types, aiming to collect groups of three to exchange them for a mug. In amongst these assorted pooches lie Mischief cards, which players use to 'Dig!' through the discard pile for a particular card, demand that players 'Gimme!' a specific colour of card if they have it, or 'Surprise!' the players hounding you by discarding a random card in their hand!

A player who manages to get a single Mug of each colour wins the game! But be careful, if any player manages to get a single pug of each colour in their hand, they can use it to steal someone else's mug!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: External Factor: The Waverley-Guerin Academy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The young woman stared glassy-eyed into the light, oblivious to her surroundings. The figures watching from the other side of a two-way mirror knew exactly what was going through her mind.

“Baronet Dania Selaar, sole heir to the Selaar conglomerate,” Suresh reported dryly from an open file. “Reported by her parents to have a…” he adjusted his glasses “…bit of a rebellious streak. Malleability scale four-point-five.”

Headmistress Aelani Jarett kept her gaze focused coolly on the still figure in the next room. “How long until she’s ready?” she asked neither man in particular.

“Another week, Headmistress,” Dr. Vyne answered dutifully. “That rebellious streak Mr. Suresh mentioned is complicating the process.”

Jarrett kept her gaze on Baronet Selaar. “Three days,” she said simply.

Vyne looked shocked. “Headmistress, we can’t rush this one. Although she’s responding to the process, any pushing we do will undo months of work. We’re lucky we got her this far without…”

Then Vyne noticed the look of frosty contempt. His protest died in his throat. Behind Jarrett, Suresh shifted uneasily.

“Three days,” she repeated, carefully and evenly.

A chastened Vyne wordlessly nodded assent. The Headmistress turned and walked briskly away, Suresh hurrying to keep up.

The Waverley-Guerin Academy is an elite school dedicated to educating the children of aristocrats and preparing them for positions of leadership. Unknown to the general public, however, is exactly how the Academy goes about fulfilling its mission: employing subtle means of mind alteration and psychological manipulation to mold youngsters into the types of leaders the Academy thinks they should be.

External Factor: The Waverley-Guerin Academy is an overview of an NPC organization for 2D6 science fiction RPGs such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG), although it’s usable with other systems with a little work. The file includes a brief history of the Academy, its reason for existing, a discussion of its methods, motivations, reach, and influence, and a set of stats compatible with those found in External Factors: Organizations.

The Waverley-Guerin Academy. It knows what’s best for you.

boardgame.name: Marvel United: Playmat
boardgame.description: 90 cm in diameter round playmat with stitched edging available in the Kickstarter for Marvel United.

listing.notes: Cardboard tube with the mat was opened. Mat was laid out on table. Mat was put back again. PM for shipping quote.

boardgame.name: Marvel United: Classic Cardboard Locations
boardgame.description:
This Kickstarter Exclusive gives you a full set of all Locations, printed on thick cardboard tiles. The normal Locations are printed on 420gsm thick laminated card stock, which works just fine for this game, since the Locations are not placed together to form a board. However, we understand that some players prefer thick cardboard tiles for these Locations, so we’ve decided to offer them the option of acquiring exactly what they want.

The Cardboard Location Tiles set includes copies of all Locations found in the Marvel United core box and all of its expansions, for a total of 44 tiles:

8 Location Tiles – Marvel United core box
12 Location Tiles – The Infinity Gauntlet
6 Location Tiles – Tales of Asgard
6 Location Tiles – Rise of the Black Panther
6 Location Tiles – Guardians of the Galaxy Remix
6 Location Tiles – Enter the Spider-Verse


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: DreamQuest
boardgame.description:
DreamQuest is part 2 in a series of solo narrative-driven card games set in the worlds created by H.P Lovecraft and similar pulp horror writers. Each box set expands and combines fully with previous titles in the series, adding new adventures, characters, artifacts and sanity blasting nightmares for you to experience (and survive)!

"In dreams, I have known the real clutch of stark, hideous, maddening, paralysing fear." - H. P. Lovecraft

DreamEscape is the first box set in the series.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Neon Lords of the Toxic Wasteland
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF has everyhting you need to start your own gnarly adventures on Neo-Terraxx.

Ultra-Violent and style matters RPG set in the ruins of Earth, after the Neon Wars of 1992.

Half Medieval Fantasy half SCI-FI, Neon Lords of the Toxic wasteland is a no-holds-barred to the Max game!

Now includes introduction adventure Last Outpost on the Left!!
boardgame.rpg: Neon Lords of the Toxic Wasteland

boardgame.name: The Last Outpost on the Left
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

RAD ADVENTURES IN THE FORGOTTEN FUTURE.

Does your party have what it takes to fight back against the horrors of the Wastelands? Find out now in the introduction adventure to "Neon Lords of the Toxic Wasteland"!
boardgame.rpg: Neon Lords of the Toxic Wasteland

boardgame.name: Thirsty for More!: Solo Rules and Adventure for Neon Lords of the Toxic Wasteland
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Here it is! Not only is this the solo rules and a sweet adventure to put your favorite character through the wringer, but it’s also the FIRST official supplement to “Neon Lords of the Toxic Wasteland”! Pretty neat stuff! Not to mention who doesn’t like playing a “Kevin McCallister” like character fashioning traps out of the crap a rat-man drug cartel left in an abandoned trap house? Exactly! Plus you get to continue the campaign with a slew of “Solo Gigs” and a massive random dungeon generator that’s like a lot of playtime.

So take a few shots of trash water, strap on your fanny pack, ready your slasher, and dive right in. Take on the vile mutie scum of the wasteland all alone and come back stinking filthy rich!
boardgame.rpg: Neon Lords of the Toxic Wasteland

boardgame.name: Steele City Sourcebook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In 2033, Prometheus Medical patented the first superhuman.

Sixteen years of inter-corporate warfare followed. By the end of it, the human population of the Fractured States of America had withdrawn into select, over-crowded cities, huddling amidst concrete and the wash of neon while thier corporate betters remade society in a new image.

Steele City is the ruins of an industrialist's dream. Located in the northeastern Fractured States, in an area that used to be Pennsylvania. It's foundation rests on an artificial island in Lake Erie, with a mile-long bridge connecting the metropolis back to the shore. Traffic swarms across the bridge, both foot and vehicle and cargo VTOLs thunder through the ari. Transporting shipping containers full of manufactured goods into and out of the city.

While not the most peaceful place to live, Steele City is tremendously prosperous...at least for the people on the top. For the poor, the sick, the politically inclined ...and for any Enhanced that don't much like the idea of thier blood and bones being corporate property...Steele City is the same as everywhere else. The economy is booming. The average person is poorer than ever and only the constant presence of the Peacekeepers prevents hordes of ravenous mutants from dragging civilians down into the sewers.

Contained in this book is full guide to Steele City, including it's factions, districts, and locales, as well as a thorough stockpile of plot hooks, NPCs and actionable rumors.

boardgame.name: Wicked Pacts: A Modern Day Game of Magic
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

At 21:05 a stiff comes into the morgue.

He's middle-aged. White. No ID. Covered in lacerations.

At 21:15 he reanimates and tries to take a chunk out of the medical examiner. Luckily, the medical examiner is a necromancer, and she's one of your people, so that's how you get the call. The stiff is still thrashing when you get there, despite him being harpooned to the floor with an Angel-forged broadsword, and the medical examiner says she hasn't ever seen a reanimation like this. Together you call up the man's soul, now trapped in endless replay of the moments leading to his death, but all it does is scream.

"And I was beginning to think," the medical examiner says dryly, "that this was going to be a slow week."

You're only half-listening at this point, because all you can think about now is motive. Was this a Syndicate job? A failed possession? An unregistered artifact? A natural death near a Ley Line?

You're still thinking about motive when a blood-curdling howl shreds the night and a werewolf comes through the front windows of the office upstairs, broken glass raining down around it, claws skidding on the tiles. You've been expecting this attack for weeks, ever since you shut down that smuggling operation, and your pistol is already in your right hand--a spell forming in your left.

"You might want to get down," you tell the medical examiner and hurl a fireball at the stairs.

Welcome to the world of Wicked Pacts.


Wicked Pacts is a tabletop roleplaying game about mages, criminals, and about how far you'll go to see that real justice gets done--all set against a backdrop of covert wars, occult powers, and supernatural menace. It is the third game by the Polyhedral Knights, providing players with an easy-to-learn system, satisfyingly deep gameplay, and a pulpy, old-school feel--all set against a backdrop of magic, mistrust, and gun smoke.

boardgame.name: Death Horizon: Reloaded
boardgame.description:
Death Horizon: Reloaded is a VR first person shooter, and a sequel and reimagining of Death Horizon. You are a lone soldier who must fight your way through hordes of zombies to investigate the mysterious Horizon labs.

user summary

boardgame.name: Dungeons & Drinks
boardgame.description:
Dungeon & Drinks, by Julián Chab, is a game for 2 to 6 players in which you are a drunken hero, who enters with his friends a dungeon full of dangers and monsters that did not bother anyone.

In each game the players compete to see who is the best taking and killing defenseless monsters. Something that would be very simple ... if the other players weren't bothering you to prevent you from fulfilling your plans.

The game ends when, after an "epic" combat, one of the players manages to kill the dungeon boss. At that moment, the one with the most points wins!

boardgame.name: Get Stuffed!
boardgame.description:
Get Stuffed! is a Christmas-themed card game for 2-6 players.

As one of Santa's elves, your aim is to fill your stocking with the items on your stocking list before everyone else.

But keep an eye on all the other mischevious elves. They are either trying to put lumps of 'Noel the Coal' into your stocking to get you fired or steal your items. They will do anything to stop you from winning.

The most cunning elf will win the day, become Santa's favourite and tell the others to Get Stuffed!

—description from the publisher

Wicked Pacts NPC Profile: Victor Dominique

boardgame.name: The Dark Village
Le Village Sombre
boardgame.description:
The Dark Village is a narrative adventure game, playable solo, but also for many others. It invites you to investigate in a strange place in order to shed light on your past.

The game offers 3 different and complementary endings, and several hours of gameplay.

The game takes place in a small village at the end of the 19th century. You play as a person looking for answers about past events.

It is a game of exploration and deduction, a kind of game where you are the hero but in an open world.

The game comes with 10 booklets of 16 pages each, and the rules are very short, you start the adventure after a few seconds of reading.

-1 special backer's token bag (purple and gold with the Overboss logo and "Original Backer")

This was a stretch goal in the Overboss Kickstarter campaign. It will not be included in the retail version of the base game. In the future, it may be available (in whole or in part) at conventions, on the publisher's website, or in retailer incentive kits.

Tower tiles allow a stack of up to three monsters, with the topmost monster considered for scoring bands and other effects. Tower tiles earn 1 point each plus 1 point per monster stacked upon it.

boardgame.name: Libram of Lost Spells, Volume 9
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Libram of Lost Spells takes you on a trip through time to reach back to older editions of the 'World's Most Popular Roleplaying Game' and enjoy some of the greatest spells of those days of yore, forgotten to the current game's 5th edition.

We've recreated these spells with great care, bringing them to life again for the 5th edition of the game. Each volume presents 20 "new" spells that you may recognize with great fondness.

Enjoy the nostolgia of these great spells once more or just interject some surprises of new spells into your games today!

boardgame.name: Survival Series: Mirage
boardgame.description:
During a routine reconnaissance mission over the Gobi desert during WW2, a strange and sudden loss of flight controls renders your aircraft downed and in flames...

Surviving the crash is only the start of your epic struggle to survive.

Whilst swiftly salvaging what you can from the burning wreckage, you realise you are very alone and at the mercy of the elements and whatever else may lurk here.

Survival will not be easy, but you make your way out into the desert expanse, in the hope of finding civilisation, sanctuary.....and survival.

Mirage is a lightweight, fun, solo adventure card game, partly inspired by the retro classic text based adventure video games of old and with lovingly drawn art. Its a great game for when you need that quick gaming fix as it sets up and plays in as little as 10 - 15 minutes.

In Mirage, you must survive for six days. Search the Gobi Desert by placing your 'Exploration Tokens' at specific areas and resolving 'Exploration' cards . These will either be helpful or harmful locations, useful items or dangerous enemy encounters.

Choose areas wisely, as exploring the same place will have a smaller effect on your stats, .....BUT, cause you to be ambushed by a stalking enemy. Searching further afield has a more detrimental effect on your stats but you are not subject to the punishing ambush attack.

Manage your vital stats of Health, Water and Stamina in order to stay alive. Adapt your strategy based on your current stats and items at hand.

As well as the 'Standard' game challenge, you can play as one of several realistic Royal Air Force characters to further bring the game to life. Each character comes with specific starting items and stats. The 'Epic' level challenge will certainly keep you tested to the max!!

Welcome to the first in the Survival Series.....welcome to Mirage!.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: War & Write: Europe
boardgame.description:
War & Write is a series of strategic level writing game. The first volume is "Europe", which simulates the Europe theater during World War Two. One player leads the Allies and the other leads the Axis. There are six rounds in the game.

Players write down his/her commands secretly and reveal at the same time. There are three commands, diplomacy, reinforcement, or operation. Player controls more Flag areas win the game at the end of the sixth round. If there is a tie, Axis wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: L.A.M.A. Édition Party
L.A.M.A. Party Edition
LAMA párty
boardgame.description:
In L.A.M.A., you want to dump cards from your hand as quickly as you can, but you might not be able to play what you want, so do you quit and freeze your hand or draw and hope to keep playing?

Each player starts a round with six cards in hand; the deck consists of llama cards and cards numbered 1-6, with eight copies of each. On a turn, the active player can play a card, draw a card, or quit. To play a card, you must play the same number as the top card of the discard pile or one number higher. If a 6 is on the discard pile, you can play a 6 or a llama, and if a llama is on top, you can play another llama or a 1. If you quit, you place your remaining cards face down and take no further actions in the round.

The round ends when one player empties their hand or all players have quit. In either case, players collect tokens based on the cards in front of them, whether in hand or on the table. Each different number card in hand gets you white tokens (each worth 1 point) equal to the value of the card while one or more llamas gets you a black token (worth 10 points). If you played all your cards, you can return one token (white or black) that you previously collected to the supply. You then shuffle all the cards and begin a new round.

The game ends the round that at least one player has forty or more total points. Whoever has the fewest points wins!

L.A.M.A. Party Edition differs from the original L.A.M.A. in three ways:


The game includes a single pink llama card that can be played on top of any card; this pink is worth -20 points if in hand at the end of a round.
Some number cards are now "plus" cards, e.g., 4+, and when you play one of these cards, you take another turn immediately.
The game includes pink tokens worth 20 points, so your luck can turn around quickly if you win a round and ditch one of those!

boardgame.name: Kemet: Blood and Sand – Book of the Dead
Kemet: Das Buch der Toten
Kemet: El Libro de los Muertos
Kemet: O Livro dos Mortos
聖域：亡者之書
케메트: 사자의 서
boardgame.description:
In Kemet: Blood and Sand, the gods of Ancient Egypt war with each other in epic battles using every tool at their disposal. Some are even willing to consult the Book of the Dead, seeking forbidden knowledge of the Beyond, and the ability to call upon darker, more powerful, and more dangerous powers…

Thanks to the Book of the Dead expansion, you have access to some of the most powerful power tiles in the entire Kemet: Blood and Sand universe. However, access to this terrifying knowledge comes with a cost, as you will have to sacrifice your units to feed the Beyond. By doing so, you'll sink into putrefaction, lose more and more prestige over your opponents, and even part with your precious victory points. This is the price to pay for access to such fearsome abilities and the most frightening of possibilities. Perhaps you will learn to summon the monstrous Apophis, a being of pure evil that dwells in the Underworld. Perhaps you can bend the all-knowing Thoth, the repository of the dark knowledge, to your will. If you are prepared to pay the high price for consorting with such dark forces, they will be formidable allies in your conquest of the black lands of Kemet: Blood and Sand.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Harvest Moon: The Lost Valley – Bachelor and Bachelorette
boardgame.description: Adds Andrea the clockmaker or Luke the medicine man to the game. It’s easier to win the love of the DLC bachelor and bachelorette than the ones included in Harvest Moon: The Lost Valley.

boardgame.name: Harvest Moon: Skytree Village – Bachelorette
boardgame.description: The female bachelor is a resident of the underworld who is very unfamiliar with the above world culture. She is kind despite her place of origin but she can be quite focused when needed.

boardgame.name: Harvest Moon: Skytree Village – Bachelor

boardgame.name: Harvest Moon: Light of Hope – New Marriageable Characters Pack
boardgame.description: Expand your experience with new and exciting content! Two new eligable residents have moved into Beacon Town! Shirlock, a fledgling journalist and self-proclaimed detective who is studying under the tutelage of Naomi, and Michelle, Doc's research partner. She's just as much of a genius as Doc, and like him, she has an unusual way of speaking and thinking.

boardgame.name: Harvest Moon: Light of Hope – Divine Marriageable Characters Pack
boardgame.description: Ever wonder what it'd be like to woo the Harvest Goddess or Gorgan? Well, now you can! Get to know the Harvest Goddess and Gorgan on a deeper level and marry them!

boardgame.name: Burocracia
boardgame.description:
A game in which you will have to go through countless administrative obstacles to do a simple procedure. Innovative game that puts the calmest and most patient people to the test.

Instructions:

Cards and money are dealt. Each player will receive $ 1000 for expenses, stamping, fines and finances and five "counter deck" cards that must be visible to their opponents and which are the counters to go to achieve the sealing of the process.
The undistributed banknotes will constitute the treasury and next to the leftover cards from the "counter deck" and the "disposition deck" cards, it must be located in some space near the board.
In turn, each player rolls the die. Take your token to the right place and you can choose whether or not to pick up a card from the "layout deck."
If a player decides not to roll the die to stay at the window and get a card from the "disposition deck", he must pay $ 50 to the treasury.
Once the move is made, the "disposition deck" card is placed at the end of the deck. Every three or four coats the cards in the "layout deck" should be shuffled.
The "disposition deck" cards contain rewards and penalties.
To complete the process and win the game, you must obtain the sealing of the five "counter deck" cards received without having debts with the treasury.
To determine the winner, all players must play the same number of turns.


—description from the publisher (translated)


Un juego en que tendrás que atravesar incontables obstáculos administrativos para hacer un simple trámite. Novedoso juego que pone a prueba a las personas más tranquilas y pacientes.

Instrucciones:

Se reparten las cartas y el dinero. Cada jugador recibirá $1000 para gastos, timbrado, multas y finanzas y cinco cartas de “mazo de ventanillas” que deben quedar a la vista de sus oponentes y que indican cuáles son las ventanillas a recorrer para lograr el sellado del trámite.
Los billetes no repartidos constituirán el fisco y junto a las cartas sobrantes del "mazo de ventanillas" y a las tarjetas del "mazo de disposiciones" se debe ubicar en algún espacio cercano al tablero.
A su turno, cada jugador arroja el dado. Lleva su ficha al lugar indicado y puede optar por levantar o no una tarjeta del "mazo de disposiciones".
Si un jugador decide no arrojar el dado para permanecer en la ventanilla y sacar tarjeta del "mazo de disposiciones" debe pagarle $50 a fisco.
Una vez hecha la jugada, la tarjeta de "mazo de disposiciones" se coloca al final del mazo. Cada tres o cuatro manos se debe mezclar las tarjetas del "mazo de disposiciones".
Las tarjetas del "mazo de disposiciones" contienen premios y castigos.
Para completar el trámite y ganar el juego hay que obtener el sellado de las cinco cartas de "mazo de ventanillas" recibidas sin tener deudas en el fisco.
Para determinar el ganador, todos los jugadores deben jugar la misma cantidad de turnos.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Anatomy of a Wizard's Tower
TRAILseeker (Issue 91 - 2017)
boardgame.description: Anatomy of a Wizard's Tower

boardgame.name: It's SewerSide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's description:

Forget alligators, crocodiles, plague-ridden rats and other sewer dwellers of urban legend. Sure, they exist, but what you really want to worry about is the mutants! Hey, didn't know about them huh? Come on! Every science fiction series has to have mutants living in the sewers! And this is the RPG where you get to do all the spelunking you like, provided you don't expect to come up smelling of roses.

SewerSide turns the tables on the whole 'nasty things below' malarkey. Now YOU get to be the grotty horrid nastiness downstairs! Go right ahead, terrorise the human world above, you'll need to find something clean to eat after all. Just watch out for the humans coming the other way. We're talking burning torches and pitchforks here people, and that ain't wise in an environment with so much methane floating around!

With eight mutant strains to choose from, a whole host of mundane and less-than-ordinary equipment, full colour artwork done by yours truly (so that's not much of a draw huh?) random generation charts in case you just can't be bothered to choose and everything you need to play except friends, pencils, paper and dice.

A riotous (do people really still use that word?) take on science fiction roleplaying, with plenty of laughs along the way. Eat your friends! Live in the sewers! Scoff 'til you puke! It's all here...

boardgame.name: Dolphin Water Polo
boardgame.description:
In this action game, the object is for 2 players or 2 teams to score goals and baskets with their dolphin water polo team. Each play at opposite ends of the board. In front of you there is are a few levers that control the team. The board has a number of indentations, into which the ball will settle. When it does, if you press the right lever, it will be ejected upward and/or bounced forward. Of course, your opponent is trying to do the same thing, so speed is essential. A goal is worth 1 point while a basket is worth 2 points. The first player to 10 points wins!

—user summary

boardgame.name: Lone Star: Solo Rules for Mothership RPG
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Solo Role-Play is a bit different. In this form of the game, the role of the Warden is emulated using a few tables. How? The Warden is there to set up the opening scene, where the game starts and to answer your questions so you understand what your character can see, hear and do. This book provides simple tables to answer those questions for you. In addition to these question-answering tables, there are some simple guidelines to help you run a game to make the most of what solo has to offer.

boardgame.name: In Darkest Day (5E)
boardgame.description:
In Darkest Day is a 5th Edition adventure for a group of 1st-level characters. It is intended as a short side trek in an ongoing campaign and should provide for a session’s worth of play.

I originally wrote this adventure for the Savage Worlds campaign setting, Hellfrost, but provide a converted version for 5th Edition. The side trek itself is purposely generic. This allows the GM to customise it to their own campaign with ease.

In Darkest Day involves an acolyte of a death god and his nefarious plans for a young maiden. While I have included stereotype gender assignments, the genders of the victim and protagonist can easily be switched if this is preferred. The adventure also introduces a unique magic item that is used by the acolyte. There is the possibility that the item still contains a charge or two come the end of the adventure. How the players deal with this can potentially lead on to other adventures.

boardgame.name: Fifth Edition Initiative Cards
boardgame.description:
Fortiter Games presents an update to the Initiative Cards that were published by The Game Mechanics. Unfortunately, their original cards are no longer available but I have copies that they originally released. I have made the minor changes to update them to 5th Edition and present them for use.

The Game Mechanics made the original instructions Open Game Content so I will leave it to them to explain how to use the cards (suitably modified for 5th Edition). In keeping with the generous nature of the original authors, the text in quotes is Open Game Content.
Initiative Cards in Play

Before beginning play, print and fill out as many character cards as you need for the player characters, and print as many other cards as you need for monsters and/or NPCs.

When combat begins, ask the players to roll initiative while you roll initiative for any opponents and non-player characters. Set aside any cards for characters or creatures that are surprised. One by one, go around the table and ask each player for his or her character’s initiative result. Write their initiative numbers down in the space marked “INIT” on the cards. Then do the same for all the initiative rolls you make. Use a pencil—you’ll be erasing and rewriting these numbers fairly often.

Then simply begin at the top of the stack, moving each card to the bottom when that character or creature has concluded its turn. When you once again reach the first card in the initiative order, if anyone has not yet rolled initiative, ask them to roll for initiative now. Then jot down their initiative numbers, and place their cards in the proper place in the initiative order.

If a character or creature readies an action, turn that Initiative Card sideways, with the “Ready” box showing. If a character or creature falls unconscious, simply turn the card sideways facing the other direction, with the word “Unconscious” visible.

There are two boxes with “SAVE” in grey above them. These are for the characters saves (writing the type of save over the grey “SAVE”). Additional saves can be noted in the “SPECIAL/NOTES” section.

boardgame.name: Unique Magic Item Cards, Volume 1
boardgame.description:
Fifth Edition offer a number of magic items. Sometimes though, you need something a little different.


Caer Calan: a shield that helps light the way
Religious Text: provides advantage after reading with an added bonus for the truly righteous.
Tornar’s Blade: a +1 longsword
Walking Stick: a staff that helps the wielder move a little quicker.

boardgame.name: No Evil
boardgame.description: No Evil is a selection of three Fifth Edition encounters for a group of 3rd-level characters. They are intended to be dropped into in an ongoing campaign without the need for any prep. Each encounter is written with a wintry weather backdrop in mind but can be easily altered to better reflect the weather in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Magic Item Cards Template
boardgame.description: A template for creating magic item (or other) cards as a form-fillable PDF. I'm not that adept at PDF forms so there isn't the nice font and you can't add a watermarked image but the basics are there.

boardgame.name: The Fen Orc Almanac 2020
boardgame.description:
Fen Orc presents six one-shot scenarios for BLUEHOLME and Old School Fantasy RPGs. Each will fill a session, all are suitable for starting character and full notes for the GM include maps, PC motivations, NPC tactics, monster abilities, secrets and descriptive text.

A sinister undead-worshiping cult want you to go into one of their crypts to head off a team of tomb robbers before they rouse something hideous from its unquiet sleep!
A tyrannical pirate captain leaves you the map of the island where he buried his greatest treasure!
Can you stop the Vampyr Margrave from marrying the Duchess before the sun sets?
Can you lead your Goblin Tribe to freedom against the oppressive Elfin Empire?
A mysterious Inn with no guests where you are trapped awaiting the ominous Cold Companion...
A romantic comedy where you must play Cupid for a Dwarf lady's love-triangle...

Every scenario has a Background, Hook, full key to a 10-location Map, Epilogue and Appendices with suggestions on how the plot could unfold differently.

Dream Home: Stork
Droomhuis: Ooievaar

Dream Home: Pets
Droomhuis: Dieren

The expansion adds four Animal tokens.

The last player in the turn picks a card and places a random animal token on it. Whenever a player takes the card, they also take the token. At the end of the game whoever has the most tokens of a single animal type takes that animal.

Title: Droomhuis promo: Huisdieren Publisher: White Goblin Games

boardgame.name: Win Immunity: Stop The Virus
boardgame.description:
Immunity is a fun and educational board game for all children aged 5 to 75. A game with lots of twists and turns and Great Fun for family and Friends.

Immunity is dealing with the spread of viruses and the actions to be taken of eradicating them.

In reality, when we humans get infected by a
virus, we have our immune system to protect us
by using anti-bodies to fight the invisible “invader”.
Once the threat is eliminated our bodies develop
Immunity against the virus so that the next time
another one attack us we are prepared to deal with
it easily Immunity follows the same rules. The game could be played by 2 to 4 people at a time.

The game consists of four levels:
Contamination, Quarantine, “Cross-Immunization”
and Immunity. Each level requires different actions to be taken, leading the players to obtaining IMMUNITY. The player with the most
Anti-body points/counters collected wins the game

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Espire 1: VR Operative
boardgame.description: Inspired by games like Metal Gear and Siphon Filter, Espire 1 is a VR first person shooter where you stealthily complete missions while controlling a remote-controlled humanoid robot.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 AGD Awards Best AR/VR of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Tenun Tycoon
boardgame.description:
Play as a team of business minded people and lead your company and popularize the tenun fabric industry. Build your tenun fabric enterprise from the design, collaboration, production, and commercial side of each player role. Manage fluctuating budgets within the company and lead your establishment to become the best tenun fabric producer!

The game spans within 12 turns, and at the beginning of every turn, roll 5 investor dice. The value of dice is the budget for that turn and is shared for every division within the company. Budget allocation for each division should be considered very carefully as each division has their own needs. The value in a dice is exact and cannot be split, and must be spent without leftovers.

Each player within the company has a pivotal role to ensure the company’s best interest. Executive role is in charge of action points management for each division, hiring new employees, and training them. Operation role is in charge of designing fabric, quality improvement, and material acquisition. Marketing role is in charge of engaging new customers, sales, and establishing brick and mortar outlets.

The game ends at the end of turn 12. The final score is determined by the amount of earnings gained reduced by the amount of expense. Milestone achievement for any category also affects positively for the final score.

boardgame.name: Calidar: Conversion Guide to Meryath for Vintage Roleplaying
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Conversion Guide is an indispensable referee’s companion as Calidar sourcebooks are otherwise system-neutral. It provides all game statistics written for Labyrinth Lord Basic Roleplaying mechanics. This supplement covers the three books in Calidar’s Meryath arc:

CAL1 “In Stranger Skies” Gazetteer
PG1 “Players’ Guide to Meryath”
CA1 “Dreams of Aerie” Adventure


Each of the original books is treated as a separate chapter in this Conversion Guide, exactly in the same order as presented in the source material. Each translated entry shows easy-to-use page references linking back to the source material. This conversion booklet goes a bit further, as it provides game stats that weren't included in CAL1, delving with great detail into the Star Phoenix's crew, the foes, and the monsters.

boardgame.name: Calidar: Conversion Guide to Meryath compatible with the OSRIC system
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Conversion Guide is an indispensable referee’s companion as Calidar sourcebooks are otherwise system-neutral. It provides all game statistics written for the OSRIC System. This supplement covers the three books in Calidar’s Meryath arc:

CAL1 “In Stranger Skies” Gazetteer
PG1 “Players’ Guide to Meryath”
CA1 “Dreams of Aerie” Adventure


Each of the original books is treated as a separate chapter in this Conversion Guide, exactly in the same order as presented in the source material. Each translated entry shows easy-to-use page references linking back to the source material. This conversion booklet goes a bit further, as it provides game stats that weren't included in CAL1, delving with great detail into the Star Phoenix's crew, the foes, and the monsters.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Doctor Deva Sahir-Morgan & Doctor Hollis Whitehall
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The advent of humans with exceptional powers also ushered in an era of unequaled technological innovation and advancement. Computers, communication systems, defense platforms, and artificial intelligence have all enjoyed evolutionary leaps forward. For example, the world has witnessed the creation of sentient machines, including the beneficial variety such as Tau of Strikeforce One, or of the inimical variety such as Zero One. The accelerated pace of advancement has forever changed the world in ways we only now can appreciate.

Many different corporations, governmental agencies, and non-governmental organizations have tried to guide or manipulate technological development with varying degrees of success. Corporations, focused solely on profit, seek to exploit and control technology without thought for the future. Governmental agencies, on the other hand, often attach a burdensome degree of regulation and bureaucratic weight that slows or stalls the pace of advancement. Both corporations and governments emphasize using technology to build bigger and more powerful weapons.

From its inception, the multinational corporation, Twilight, Inc., pursued a different strategy. This corporation seeks to use technology to better the world and advance quality of life while still earning a profit—profit that enables them to pursue further research and development. Beyond this strategy, however, Twilight, Inc. locates, develops, and supports scientists in many different disciplines of scientific study. The company helps anyone with the requisite intelligence and talent to gain the education needed to pursue a scientific career. The company provides more grants, scholarships, and endowments to more people and schools than any other organization in the world.

This PDF contains everything you need to know about the Twilight Inc. members, Doctor Deva Sahir-Morgan & Doctor Hollis Whitehall in the Amazing Universe Campaign or any other superhero campaign.
boardgame.rpgseries: Official Handbook of the Amazing Universe

boardgame.name: Totem Troubles
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A strange wizard brings an unusual totem and begins to tell his tale. Then things get weird in the central plaza of Anu! Our free offering of the month puts a twist on statue problems!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign, for a quartet of 1st level characters.

boardgame.name: Sorcerous Origin: The Pooka
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“I have a what now? That’s absolutely absurd. Can’t be possible. Well actually - and this is hilarious - now that I’m remembering the Caper’s Ball...”
- Brillig-Wren, regent of the Chaos Court

Your bloodline comes from the peculiar and wily Pooka, a powerful entity that leads the Court of Chance among the fey of the EarthenRhyne. Although Pooka are well known for their love of meddling in human affairs, that rarely extends to siring children. Nonetheless, their dalliance in your lineage has left you with powers and inclinations that they would find very entertaining.

This supplement includes:

The Pooka Sorcerer Archetype!
A heritage table to let you pick which Pooka you inherited your quirks from.
A new meta magic option.

boardgame.name: Dragon+ (Issue 32 - Jun 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Join our exclusive tour of Icewind Dale as we dip into the upcoming release Rime of the Frostmaiden! Plus, every highlight from D&D Live 2020: Roll w/ Advantage.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: The Best of the Dungeon Masters Guild
Maps of the Month: Mythic Odysseys of Theros, Acquisitions Incorporated, The Green Dragon Inn
Playing D&D Remotely: Virtual Tabletop Software

boardgame.name: Journey Z
boardgame.description:
Competitive zombie-themed card game where 3 to 5 players pass through places taken by the living dead trying to survive and fulfill the game's objectives to achieve victory. Each player chooses a survivor with different characteristics and receives at the beginning of the game a goal that is inspired by several films of the genre.

During the game, players face the undead with the roll of the dice that is also used to activate cards that can be used both for combat and to help them fulfill their secret objectives and win the game.

Other locations can enter play, symbolizing the path taken by the survivors. The entire turn, players draw a survivor card, which can be actions or equipment (simplifying), and also draw a zombie card, which can be the undead themselves, or some negative event that occurs on the turn. Drawing zombies always stay in the same location, affecting all players who are there. For this reason the more people in the same place, the more dangerous it becomes.

The combat in the game is performed with the dice roll, where the result is added to the survivor's equipment and skills. Zombies don't roll damage, but they get a bonus for quantity, the more zombies, the more difficult it is. When there is no way to fight the survivors can always escape, which is done in a similar way.

To win the game they must fulfill their objective cards, which have three tasks each. These activities can be killing a certain number of zombies, being in a certain place or having an item. Each objective is different and they follow a short narrative present in the cards. With the three tasks completed, the game is won, if the survivor manages to stay alive until the end of his turn.

Journey Z is a game with a lot of interaction between players, and this can be directly or indirectly, as two people in the same place, even just interacting with the zombies, can completely change the other's plans. Manipulate the result of the die roll, or use cards to gain advantages in confrontations with the undead, but the main thing is to be aware of your victory conditions and know how to use your resources to reach it as quickly as possible.

'-description from designer

boardgame.name: Saturday Legends
boardgame.description:
Saturday Legends is the followup game to the highly successful Friday Night Legends. This time, you coach the greatest college football teams of all time against each other based on their actual stats.

The core of the SL game engine is based on hours of in-depth and meticulous hours of research.

The game system is elegant in its simplicity that allows you to do what you want to do coach and play games with your college gridiron heroes. Players act as the coach for their chosen team and make all the critical decisions like their real life counterparts do. In a matchup between two players, you each simultaneously select which play to run (in secret) and reveal them. SL's elegance comes from its years of development, using a system of a few simple die rolls and simple math of the addition and subtraction of results when the players look up those results on their respective team sheets. Team tendencies in terms of their breakdown in running vs. passing plays are tracked on the simple score pads. The easy to use individual team chart replicates the strengths and weaknesses of each team. SL's unique and easy to use system enables you to compare and play powerhouse larger schools against the small schools. The fast playing time of 60-90 minutes both allows you to play more games in short order while still capturing the fun and essence of college football.

The game designers responded with adding more teams across the country and continue to meet that demand from game players with the plans to expand their college football team universe.

boardgame.name: Star Realms: Sleeves
boardgame.description: Official Star Realms sleeves. Initially 50 sleeves per pack, later changed to 60.

boardgame.name: Cheesy Tosser's: Wargaming Rules for a Village Sporting Event
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Cheesy Tosser's a tabletop miniatures game with a fun sporting theme.
Think Bloodbowl meets the middle ages, a football rugby mashup between two opposing villages all with a bit of light hearted fun.
The rules have been written to create a fast paced, easy to learn game especially suitable for a fun evening, club or show game.
These rules are diceless, instead using a deck of standard playing cards to add friction and resolve the mechanics.
Players have a hand of three cards which they can use individually or chain together to activate one or multiple team members.
The aim? to hit the opponents pub with the cheese!
Options for multiplayer and alternate settings also included, along with access to a Tabletop simulator module, player roster and QRS.

Men and women have been daft for hundreds of years now. Examples of what can happen when boredom, beer and too much sunshine mix can be seen in our countryside culture and folklore. Village games and rivalry date back to the Doomsday book and still hold a place in our national pride. One such tradition and probably the original concept for the games of football and rugby, was the Annual Langtoft and Baston Cheese tossing. It involved teams of locals from each respective village attempting to cover the front of the opposing village’s pub in stinking cheese. Often participants were drunk and sometimes dressed inappropriately, we’ve all known a village idiot! Records show no one was ever fatally injured, more through luck than judgment. Play continued until everyone was too tired to carry on, had had enough or the landlord of the respective pub could stand the stench no more and offered a truce by way of a wagon load of Badgers Bite Brown Ale and the subsequent piss up to the conquering village. Such fun has even witnessed festive games played using Christmas puddings instead of cheese and decorated hard boiled dragons’ eggs at Easter!

You can now recreate this spectacle on your table top as follows.
Silly hats and a pint in hand are optional but recommended.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Open Combat: Sword Masters
boardgame.description:
Open Combat - Sword Masters

Extra skills, abilities, weapons, scenarios and rules to expand your games of Open Combat

The full colour A4 supplement for Open Combat includes:

New skills and abilities specifically for sword fighter models to capture the sense of drama and/or flamboyance often associated with them
Extra skills for general use
New items of equipment
New terrain rules including: swinging from chandeliers/rigging, low obstacles (trip hazards), improvised projectiles (such as kicking/throwing things from tables) and more
New scenarios to play including The Duel, For Honour and Brawl
Plus sample profiles, two new actions, guidance for setting up terrain using the new rules for maximum mayhem and advice for linking games together into a micro campaign.


Scenarios include:

'The Duel', one versus one combat (perfect for a super quick game or to try out new approaches to creating profiles).
'For Honour' where warbands fight for the honour of their clan/school/family in ritual combat and
'The Brawl', where we see a fight erupt out in an otherwise relatively peaceful environment (models start unarmed but they can scrabble to grab a weapon as the fighting gets under way).


Also included are hints and tips, Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) along with sample profiles for a selection of combatants to help inspire you (or to pick from if you're a bit short on time).

THIS IS A SUPPLEMENT. OPEN COMBAT IS REQUIRED TO USE THIS PUBLICATION.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Attaque Zombie Attack
boardgame.description:
In this strategic cards game, you must form the strongest zombies horde killing other player's survivors, making them zombies. Do you have what it take to survive in this infernal world ?

Dans ce jeu de cartes stratégique, vous devez former la horde de zombies la plus puissante en zombifiant les personnages de vos adversaires. Saurez-vous survivre dans ce monde infernal?

boardgame.name: Blätterrauschen
Le Murmure des Feuilles
Rustling Leaves
El Susurro de las Hojas
boardgame.description: Blätterrauschen ("Rustling Leaves") is a roll-and-write game, and for every season — spring, summer, autumn, and winter — there is a themed game sheet with different rules. The numbers on the dice reveal the side lengths of the area marked on the game sheet. In this area, a forest symbol is selected that is included in the scoring. Whoever collects the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Intergalactic Fishing
boardgame.description:
Intergalactic Fishing is a single-player fishing RPG that makes use of procedurally generated content and graphics. You play as an angler tasked with solving the mystery of what is causing the fish to die in your local lake. You must travel to many different lakes all over the universe, exploring, catching fish, gathering data, completing quests, upgrading your gear, and talking with other anglers and scientists in order to figure out what is going on.

Features

Explore countless lakes all over the universe
Explore the dozens of populated lakes in the ULT Network or venture into the unknown and explore uncharted lakes. With procedurally generated lakes and fish species, there is always something unique and interesting to discover.

Fish behavior simulation
Each fish in the lake is individually simulated. Fish behave differently based on their species, size, habits, lure preferences, time of day, their surroundings, etc. Learn about how a species behaves to catch more fish!

Use your BOAT to travel the universe
The Buoyant Object for Above-Water Travel (or BOAT) is a high-tech watercraft equipped with a Universal Lake Teleporter capable of near-instant teleportation to lakes all over the universe. Your BOAT is also equipped with underwater jets for precise maneuverability in the water, a lure fabricator that can create custom-designed lures on demand, and several module slots that allow you to customize your BOAT to your liking.

Design your own lures
Target certain fish species by designing a lure that they will be more likely to bite. Try to create a lure with the perfect stats and behavior with your available lure parts and mods.

Participate in Tournaments
Join fishing tournaments and compete for prizes against the best anglers in the universe. The live leaderboard shows you how you are doing during the tournament.

Take on Fish Contracts
Accept Fish Contracts to catch a certain species of fish from a certain lake then go out to the lake, get your fish, and turn it in for a reward.

Meet other anglers and complete quests
In your travels, you may come across other anglers who can give you some information about the lake or the fish in the lake, or perhaps you will meet someone who needs help and has a quest for you.

Upgrade your gear
Sell valuable fish, complete quests, win tournaments, gather and sell data about lakes and fish species, and complete fish contracts in order to upgrade your gear. Get a better BOAT, a stronger rod, or modules for your BOAT that add new functionality.

Flexible main story quest
The main quest acts as a guide to introduce the player to the different activities in the game, but you can strike off on your own and do whatever you feel like at any time and return to the main quest later.

Detailed career stat tracking
Keep a tally of just about everything you do from number of fish caught to total credits earned to number of lakes visited.

Source: The Game Press Kit.

boardgame.name: 遺跡ヲユク (Iseki wo yuku)
boardgame.description:
遺跡ヲユク (Iseki wo yuku) is a Japanese card game. Players are exploring the dangerous ruins of a dungeon, trying to survive and keep the treasure they find. Players co-operate, but may betray each other in order to escape the dungeon.
user summary

boardgame.name: Pop-Tarts Game
boardgame.description:
It's a race to grab the most Pop-Tarts from a parade of pastries lined up between the freezer and the toaster.

On your turn in Pop-Tarts Game, eat the Pop-Tarts card at the front of the line. Before taking a bite, though, you can play action cards to move Pop-Tarts around, create delicious combos, or reverse the direction they're going to improve your chomping chances. After all the Pop-Tarts are gone, the player who "ate" the most points wins!

boardgame.name: Something Wild! Mickey and Friends
boardgame.description:
Something Wild is a line of card games featuring beloved characters and collectible Pop! pocket figures. Play numbered and colored character cards to make sets and runs. The first player to score three powers wins the game.

With Something Wild: Mickey and Friends, you can score a set to snag the Mickey Mouse figure's special power to help you win!

Combine Character Cards in sets and runs to score points, just like in Rummy. Use Power Cards to add a fun twist to the classic card gameplay.

Combine multiple Something Wild! games to add more character cards, more Pop! figures, and more powers to your game!

boardgame.description:
GAME SYSTEM



This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.

boardgame.name: Footloose Party Game
boardgame.description:
Play as rebellious teens dancing against the small town’s “no dancing” law! Cut loose around Bomont, from the drive-in diner and the old mill to the honky tonk, pushing your luck to gain points. Score bonuses by winning a tractor-chicken face-off or the dance-off at the Prom. To win, break the rules, but don’t get busted! With its colorful retro look and fun and flexible “finger shoes,” this family-friendly party game celebrates the 1980s hit movie in style!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fifth Edition Condition Cards
boardgame.description:
The Fifth Edition rules list a number of conditions that can affect the capabilities of a character or monster. These are also included in the System Reference Document. They are easy to locate in the Player’s Handbook and are on the DM side of the official Dungeon Master’s Screen. But, sometimes it’s easier to have the information more easily to hand. Here’s where the Condition Cards come in.

I’ve put together some Condition Cards that you can print out (double-sided) for use at the gaming table. For durability you can print them out on card or paper and then laminate them. The download contains one of each card. If you’re feeling generous, you can print out a set for each player. Combine them with some plastic game card stands (similar to those that Paizo use for their pawns) and they have an easy reference guide to any conditions that affect their character.

boardgame.name: Rallyman: DIRT – 110%

24 Double-sided track tiles
6 Dashboards
Rulebook

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Reformator
boardgame.description:
A Game About Faith and Power

User summary:

Reformator ("The Reformer") is a role-playing game set during Luther's Reformation as it spreads into Sweden at the birth of the modern Swedish state. Characters engage in a historically accurate period of great social upheaval.

The game is designed to support beginning players, though sufficient for long-term campaigns. Adventures present the characters with ethical dilemmas that require collaboration to solve. The game, as written, is intended to provide as much education as entertainment.

boardgame.name: A Witcher's Journal
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Take a glimpse into the Golden Age of Witchers, when monsters roamed the world and you could hardly travel to the next town without running into a cyclops or a foglet! Through the journal of the founder of the Griffin School of Witchers, Erland of Larvik, you'll encounter many new monsters; some of which haven't been seen in generations.

A Witcher's Journal is a supplement for The Witcher Pen & Paper RPG which gives you a number of new monsters and intriguing plot hooks to use in your game as well as new lore and an indepth investigation system.

Featuring

33 New Monsters: Terrorize the countryside with all manner of creatures, from deadly archespores to gruesome vedigo!
2 Exceptional Monsters: Create unique higher vampires and true dragons to populate the dark corners and high peaks of the Continent!
An Indepth Investigation System: Learn how to write out a mystery for your players to uncover as the game progresses or write up a murder mystery for a session of fun!
All New Lore: Learn the history of the Order of Witchers ad the story of Erland of Larvik, the first Griffin!

boardgame.name: Der Herr der Ringe: Das Kartenspiel – Die Festung von Nurn
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Fortress of Nurn
Le Seigneur des Anneaux: Le Jeu de Cartes – La forteresse de Nurn
El Señor de los Anillos: El Juego de Cartas – La Fortaleza de Nurn
boardgame.description:
Your brave company of heroes steps into the very heart of Mordor, and danger is everywhere. You recently rescued prisoners from the slave-fields that surround the fortress, and now, under cover of darkness, you wait for the signal to attack the city and liberate the captives within. You’re certain that Thane Ulchor is also within this citadel, and the culmination of your quest that began so long ago may finally be within reach.

As the Vengeance of Mordor cycle rises to its ultimate confrontation with The Fortress of Nurn, you’ll lay siege to a castle in this expansion’s brand-new scenario. The contest that lies before you is mighty, but fortunately for you, new friends and allies arrive to help you along the way. This pack includes a new Spirit version of Aragorn plus new player cards for every sphere, as well as a neutral attachment and a contract that blast open the number of decks you can create for any scenario.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Anxiety Attack!
boardgame.description:
Play cards to move opponents closer to the Anxiety Spiral and yourself closer to safety.

Each turn, players play cards from their hand:

Trigger Cards are numbered 1-7 and move characters ahead toward the Anxiety Spiral.
Defuse Cards are numbered 1-3 and move characters back toward the Oasis. Play either card type on any player, including yourself. Playing one of these cards completes the player’s turn unless they want to play an Instant card.
Instant Cards can be played at any time according to the function on the card. Play them quickly before another card is played or a player moves.


If a player lands exactly on a space with an arrow, move to the space indicated. Landing on the same space as another player bumps the player who was there first ahead one space. Use Trigger and Defuse cards strategically to find safer routes for yourself and move opponents faster!

Red and Orange split paths may have certain advantages and disadvantages, choose wisely!

Landing on a Panic Room or Retreat space for the first time sends a player to a safe haven. For the next round, that player may not play nor can they be played on. After their next turn they are sent out according to the arrow, where they will be vulnerable to play. If all opponents are in safe havens a remaining player MUST play a card on themself.

The first player to be sent to the Anxiety Spiral loses. But they are not out of the game because misery LOVES company! The losing player may now move one space in either direction EVERY TIME a card is played. If the losing player lands on the same space as a remaining player, the remaining player is sent directly to the Anxiety Spiral and then begins to go after other players in the same fashion until there is only one active player.

The last person to be sent to the Anxiety Spiral is the winner!
