boardgame.name: Yuppie Psycho
boardgame.description:
Join Brian Pasternack, a young man with no future in a dystopian 90s society, on his first day at one of the world’s largest companies, Sintracorp. Uncertain, unprepared, and massively unqualified, will Pasternack have what it takes to shine in Sintracorp’s hierarchy? It all depends on how he performs on his first assignment… and whether he survives it.

During his unconventional employee orientation, Pasternack discovers what his new job really entails: hunting a “witch” whose powers made the success of the corporation possible in the first place, but who now seems to have returned to torment its employees. Brian will meet all kinds of odd characters, escape from terrible creatures, and unravel the hidden secrets of Sintracorp’s dark past.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: The Hunters A.D. 2114: Nuclear Storage Box
boardgame.description:
Store the game with expansions with this Storage Box. It has a custom plastic inserts to store all the components from Core Game, Hybrids, Shiptown and New Huntsville expansions.

Weight: 1,645 kg
Size: 43,5 x 30,5 x 20,5 cm

boardgame.name: Hey, Emily!
boardgame.description:
Emily and Karl went for a hike in the mountains. Emily isn't really an outdoor girl, but she loves him and didn't want to argue again.
The trail is long, they are geared Karl said. It was all fun until they got lost.

Karl is still missing, it’s been 3 days now.
Hey, Emily! Listen up! He said...I’m going to
find a shelter or a way out, we’ll be fine...

I’m alone! He said he’d never leave me!
I’m scared... I want to go home.
I’ve gotta move now. God help me.

Hey, Emily! is a small 1 solo game you'll play with a couple of dice, paper and pencil.
You need to help Emily to stay alive and safe from threats.
And possibly you need to help Emily to reach back to the cabin where it all started, a 6 days walk from her current position.

Using 2 dice, you'll roll on various tables. Gain, loose or spend resources, try your luck while helping Emily on her way back home. Every day is composed by 3 day actions and 3 night actions. If you survive, mark one day and try the next one.

Arrive alive at the morning of the 7th day, and you're safe.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Godtear: Keera, The Dragon Princess
boardgame.description:
On the outside, Keera is the essence of nobility. But on the inside, an untameable fire burns. Enemies are advised to tread lightly, for it is uncertain who they should fear more— the fiery mistress, or her mythical dragons.

A legend reborn - this set includes:
1x Keera, The Dragon Princess
2x Young Dragons
1x Keera’s Banner (Dragon Hatchling Egg)
All the cards you'll need to play.

boardgame.name: Colonists
boardgame.description:
Nice Planet...we'll take it.
As the master-mind of an alien race you will try to outmaneuver your competitors and reign supreme. Search out new homes for your colonists and dominate the Galaxy.

In 'Colonists', you will take on the role of the ruler of an empire. Your species is generally peaceful, but overpopulation can lead to civil unrest, and outright war. Competition is high for favorable conditions, and habitable planets.

Based off the game engine in Plenty of Fish in the Sea?

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Plenty of Fish in the Sea?

boardgame.name: Allies, Enemies, & Quests
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Expand your game with this collection of 20 unique NPCs of various Challenge Ratings. Each NPC is designed so they can used as an ally, or as an enemy. We’ve even included several quest ideas for each of the NPCs, three of which have detailed mini adventures and a map.

Written by some of the best-selling authors on the Dungeon Masters Guild, each NPC includes an image, a backstory, motives, flaws, and statistics. There are also a few new magic items.

boardgame.name: Creating Collectives
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Buy in! Take root! Expand! With this guide, players and DMs can create collectives - organizations to lead and develop through adventure and investment. Add new story hooks, goals, and complications for your players and gain the tools to leverage a collective’s influence for unique benefits and rewards. Form thieves’ guilds, thriving communities, invading forces, and more!

boardgame.name: The Rod of Seven Parts
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

In 1996, TSR published the module named “The Rod of Seven Parts”, First of the Tomes series for high level adventures. It was designed by Skip Williams, and illustrated by Glen Michael Angus, Arnie Swekel, Phillip Robb, Jim Roslof, and Erol Otus. It consisted of 3 booklets, a 16 page book of monsters, and 6 full-color maps and 6 two-sided reference cards. “The Rod of Seven Parts” was the first of the Tome series released and was followed by “The Return to the Tomb of Horrors” by Bruce Cordell and Axe of the Dwarvish Lords also by Skip Williams. This conversion guide allows DM’s to run the original module with 5th Edition rules and provides a reference sheet for numbered entries detailing the converted encounters and traps.

This conversion guide allows DMs to run the original module with 5th Edition rules and provides a reference sheet for encounters.

To use this conversion guide you will need a copy of "The Rod of Seven Parts", originally available in hard-copy and now for sale in Digital format at DMsGuild.com.

boardgame.name: Book of the Path: A Barbarian Sourcebook
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Harness your Rage like never before!
With Book of the Path you can explore the barbarian class with fresh eyes, finding new inspiration for your barbarian characters (as a player) or ways to roleplay with your barbarian players (as a DM)!

In this supplement you’ll find:
Flavorful suggestions to visually accentuate your barbarian play and make your features feel narratively impactful.

Ideas for roleplaying your barbarian characters in a manner that fits their path.

Suggestions for dreams, omens, and visions that Dungeon Masters can use with each path to give barbarian players interesting moments of plot and personal development.

Book of the Path also contains six new paths:
-The path of the battle-skald, a storytelling barbarian that summons the imagery of its war-songs into deadly reality.
-The path of the unbound, a warrior who breaks free from any bond and turns chains against those that would use them.
-The path of the possessed, a barbarian that shares its body with a vengeful spirit and gains spectral powers as a result.
-The path of the ragebringer, a combatant that inspires their allies with their lust for battle.
-The path of the timeshaper, a temporal warrior that leaves time-delayed afterimages of itself behind.
-The path of the vengeful, a barbarian that excels at turning their pain into doled-out punishment.

boardgame.name: Friends and Foes II
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Cawood Publishing presents Friends and Foes II! A 235-page Dungeon Master's guide packed with 220 NPCs (levels 13-20)! From the makers of over 30 bestselling 5E products.

This collection of NPCs includes friends to aid the heroes and foes to oppose them. Each NPC has their own stat block, background information, and equipment. Sub-classes and spells from Xanathar's Guide to Everything, and races from Volo's Guide to Monsters are also included. More than twenty-five monster NPCs can be found in the book; such as angels, devils, dragons, giants, liches, treants, and vampires.

The 235-page book includes:

220 NPCs
96 Good and Neutral NPCs (Friends) for every class, levels 13-20
96 Evil NPCs (Foes) for every class, levels 13-20
28 monster NPCs including angels, devils, dragons, giants, liches, and vampires.
Tables to build your own NPCs
All the characters can be used as pre-generated characters

boardgame.name: Rest System Revised
boardgame.description:
"TIRED of your Players abusing REST? This is a Homebrew "Full" Rest System. I make changes to Long Rest and Short Rests in Dungeons and Dragons that increase the Pacing and Role Play of your game! I add in a 3rd type of Rest called a "Full Rest" system that weaves in Down Time in between adventures! Down Time is a GREAT part of the game to let your players experience too! Its a WIN WIN!"

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: かぐや姫を笑わせて (Kaguya hime wo warawasete)
boardgame.description:
かぐや姫を笑わせて (Kaguya hime wo warawasete), meaning 'Make Princess Kaguya Laugh', is a Japanese word game.

Kaguya-hime (Princess Kaguya) has lost her smile, due to the rush of courting men who would ask her favor. Her grandfather decides to hold an entertainment party to let her laugh.

The players play the role of entertainers who join the party and must present the themes that are thrown out by the old man, and the demands from the unhappy princess. Who will win the smile from the princess?

殺到する求愛者たちのストレスから笑わなくなったかぐや姫。爺は自慢の姫に笑ってもらおうと余興会を催します。プレイヤーたちは参加芸人となり、爺からのお題とちょっと病んだ姫から出されるお願いに応えねばなりませゆ。誰がかぐや姫の笑いを勝ち取るのでしょうか。

boardgame.name: V-Rally 4
브이 랠리 4
boardgame.description:
V-Rally 4 is a racing video game developed by Kylotonn and published by Bigben Interactive for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Microsoft Windows and Nintendo Switch in 2018. The developer had previously worked on the official 2017 WRC game.

Gameplay
V-Rally 4 is a racing game where players drive rally cars through a series of stages. The game features five disciplines, with 51 cars from 19 manufacturers, including Porsche, Skoda and Norma. Courses include Monument Valley, Niger, Romania and Malaysia.

Source: Wikipedia, "V-Rally 4", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: This Vineyard Will Be Our Salvation
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:
This Vineyard Will Be Our Salvation is a character-driven story game where players take on the role of ducks and geese who, in exchange for dedicating their entire working life to The Vineyard, will be allowed to retire to Ipharadesi Island, a safe haven and paradise on earth. Play to find out who your characters are, what they are willing to do to retire in paradise, and how the long workdays in The Vineyard change and challenge them at every turn.

boardgame.name: Scents and Sensibility
boardgame.description:
Scents and Sensibility is a engine building and deconstruction game in which players are hedgehogs running a flower shop. Players pick flowers, make bouquets, and gain loyal customers, but must choose the right times to sell off their bouquets to get the most out of them before they're gone.

Can you run the best flower shop and gain the most customers?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Metal Unit
boardgame.description:
Metal Unit is a sprawling side-scrolling platformer with roguelite features.
Play as Joanna, a soldier on a mission to capture her treasonous sister. Wear the M-Unit 11 suit and battle against monsters and aliens while uncovering the truth about humanity.

The Earth is under siege from all directions, with ancient beings emerging from underground and alien machines descending from space. The fate of the planet hangs in the balance, but you can help tilt the odds by playing as Joanna, a new soldier capable of wearing the powerful M-Unit suit. Follow Joanna on her epic journey to save humanity and get revenge on her traitorous sister that has taken up arms with the alien race.

Source: The Game Website.

With 6 new fish markets and 6 new external markets, you'll be able to rent ships, hold a foreign auction, purchase research into new fish, and much more. Endless possibilities await when you add this brand new expansion to Tokyo Tsukiji Market!

boardgame.name: Hard Quiz: The Game
boardgame.description:
The game is played in four rounds. One player acts as quizmaster. The other players choose an card making them “experts” in their chosen categories. All players are eligible to answer any question in this round by signaling that one is ready to answer. Correctly answering a question in which you are the expert advances your pawn one space on the scoring track. The reward is doubled if you are not the “expert.” An incorrect response means a player must retreat one space on the scoring track.

The second round is called Tom’s Round (after the show’s host, Tom Gleeson). All questions are multiple choice about a random category. Players secretly select their responses. Correct responses are worth an assigned value. There is on penalty for an incorrect response.

The third round is called The People’s Round. Questions are about multiple subjects and rewards. Players may signal when they are ready to respond but will be penalized for giving an incorrect response. The two top scorers at the end of this round will move on to the final round: The Hard-Off.

In the Hard-Off Round, the players choose new expert categories and the player who gets the higher score is crowned Hard Quiz champion.

Hard Quiz: The Game is based on a popular Australian television quiz show.

—description paraphrased from the publisher

boardgame.name: Airline Jet Pilots Game
boardgame.description:
"Educational, entertaining and challenging" - a roll of two dice each turn determines if your jet plane moves to one of 54 cities on the map of the United States or remains idle due to a mishap!

Up to four players use their flight schedules and dice to determine where they will fly and therefore how many miles they can log each turn. A large map assists with the colorful airplane placement for each player on their turn each round.

A designated "flight captain pilot" is a player as well but is also nominally in charge of each game - their extra duties include controlling the game, assisting with the flight milage sheets, map and ensuring correct logging of milage by all players as well as assessing penalties for logging false data. They also determine at the start of the game how many rounds the game will comprise - 4, 6, 8, 10, etc.

Player rolls may result in no milage for a pilot's turn due to fog, illness, hijackings, FAA inspections and more, as described on their individual flight schedule. On the last round after everyone has had their turn, the pilot with the most logged miles wins the game!
